title: Early sign of Virat Kohli's ODI retirement? India star waves 'goodbye' to Adelaide crowd after back-to-back ducks in IND vs AUS ODIs | Sporting News India
text:
Virat Kohli's lean patch on his return to international cricket has taken yet another turn, but for the worse. The star Indian batter bagged consecutive ducks in the ongoing 2025 India vs Australia ODI series.
Add The Sporting News as a preferred news source .
After being dismissed for a duck at Adelaide, Kohli was seen waving towards the crowd with a faint smile on his face as he walked back to the dugout. Fans and commentators speculated that it might be a sign of his ODI retirement.
Whether that gesture was about this being his last ODI series down under or something more worrying: an early retirement before the 2027 ODI World Cup, it remains to be seen.
Virat Kohli bags consecutive ducks and waves goodbye to Adelaide crowd Kohli, who is known to be a master of the ODI format, two poor outings two poor outings with ducks in consecutive games for the first time in his ODI career.
After his eight-ball duck in the first ODI in Perth, Kohli was dismissed again without scoring a run in one of his favorite grounds, at the Adelaide Oval. He was trapped LBW in front by the Aussie pacer Xavier Bartlett.
Kohli remains one of India's fittest and most driven cricketers, but his lack of match practice has likely affected his form on his return to competitive cricket.
More: Virat Kohli's score in today's India vs Australia 2nd ODI at Adelaide Oval: How many runs did he score?
Was the Adelaide goodbye gesture a hint of Kohli's retirement? While Kohli's dismissal disappointed the fans, the speculations that followed could break fans' hearts. The Indian star was spotted waving goodbye to the Adelaide crowd, which led to talks about his retirement from the ODI format.
VIRAT KOHLI GONE FOR HIS SECOND DUCK OF THE SERIES! #AUSvIND | #PlayoftheDay | @BKTtires pic.twitter.com/jqIdvMeX9T
â€” cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) October 23, 2025 The Indian legend has already retired from Tests and T20Is and saw a return to International Cricket after a nearly eight-month break.
Kohli now has one more game to go before another break, and he would look to make the most of the game as India takes on Australia for the third ODI on Saturday, October 25.
